intro: Dioxippe cyanocarpa, commonly known as the blue-fruited dioxippe, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its striking blue berries. Native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes, it thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in shades of white and pale blue. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Dioxippe cyanocarpa is considered a vulnerable species.
